original_solution_mapping.L1: She reads 90-60=<<90-60=30>>30 pages in an hour.
original_solution_mapping.L2: She needs to read 210-90=<<210-90=120>>120 more pages.
original_solution_mapping.L3: For an additional 120 pages, she will need 120/30=<<120/30=4>>4 hours.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6998.
    Returns: the number of additional hours Jo will be reading the book.
    """
    # L1
    current_page = 90 # Now, she is at page 90
    page_an_hour_ago = 60 # An hour ago, she was at page 60
    pages_per_hour = current_page - page_an_hour_ago

    # L2
    total_pages = 210 # Her current book has 210 pages
    remaining_pages = total_pages - current_page

    # L3
    hours_needed = remaining_pages / pages_per_hour

    # FA
    answer = hours_needed
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: She reads {current_page}-{page_an_hour_ago}=<<{current_page}-{page_an_hour_ago}={pages_per_hour}>>{pages_per_hour} pages in an hour.
She needs to read {total_pages}-{current_page}=<<{total_pages}-{current_page}={remaining_pages}>>{remaining_pages} more pages.
For an additional {remaining_pages} pages, she will need {remaining_pages}/{pages_per_hour}=<<{remaining_pages}/{pages_per_hour}={hours_needed}>>{hours_needed} hours.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: She reads 90-60=<<90-60=30>>30 pages in an hour.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: She needs to read 210-90=<<210-90=120>>120 more pages.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: For an additional 90 pages, she will need 90/30=<<90/30=3>>3 hours.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'current_page' (value: 90) was used instead of 'remaining_pages' (value: 120).
